Brave New Obvious

  • About me

Why Brave New Obvious?

Hi, I am V. I am Head Nerd (CTO) and co-founder at Meiro, based in Brno, Czech Republic. I started Brave New Obvious as a way to document all the small victories and big facepalms I experience each day building a data product. You can find me on Twitter and Facebook.

Why the name?

Because I always have this rollecrcoaster of feelings while programming/debugging/optimizing.

First, it is excitement, approaching a new problem. I feel brave, exploring new waters.

Then, a few roadbumps. Well, not a few, but quite a lot.

In the end a victory - something I have built is working.

But more often it feels like the solution was obvious from the start. That I should have seen it and apply it rightaway, that I haven’t done my homework properly.

But is it really the case? There is this czech saying: “After a battle, everyone is a general.” The solution in hindsight looks straightforward, obvious. But was it really from the start, before I jumped through all the loops, made numerous iterations?

This is where you come in.

I need your help to decide if the solution was obvious or not

In this blog I am describing my learnings, solutions to the problems, tips and hints. Hacks, proper solutions, best practices, but also mistakes I made. And I would be glad if you could learn from my mistakes rather then you do them on your own.

I would like to know if the content I share to you is valuable, something that helped you make your project better, more capable, faster. I would like to know you learned something new that you can use in your life.

You can let me know exactly that by buying me a coffee, or sending me a piece of crypto.

or send a piece of crypto my way to

  • BTC: bc1q2r9rtdpuuf3uwckns8rxeaqpxeyl34jx6a26ez

If you do that, it tells me two things:

  1. The content I create has a value to someone else than me.
  2. Because it has a value to someone else, I should continue to do it.

And I really love to share knowledge. Please, keep me motivated :))

Thank you!
